description:
In the distant future, humankind lives shoulder-to-shoulder in a cramped "Colony" divided by bedrock. Outside the colony extends a dangerous undeveloped area known as "The Labyrinth." Those who risk their lives to explore the Labyrinth and mark undeveloped areas are known as "Markers." Memempu is a young girl who wants to become a Marker, and Gagumber is a man who quit being a Marker. This rag-tag father and daughter team are about to take on the Labyrinth! "If there is no path, then dig one!

(Source: Crunchyroll)

Note: Episode 1 had an early screening during Virtual Crunchyroll Expo 2021 on August 5, 2021.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

title.native: 魔法使いになれなかった女の子の話。

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Lownine)

Kazuma Kouda is a concept artist. He is best known as the concept artist for NieR: Automata. He has done artwork for Bayonetta 2, Pokémon: Let's Go Pikachu! and Fire Emblem: Three Houses.

[Website](https://endoh-masaaki.com/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCBnCeOigma9Cv6eI5_QleQQ) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/遠藤正明) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masaaki_Endoh)

Masaaki Endou is a Japanese singer-songwriter who is prominent in the area of soundtracks for anime and tokusatsu productions. He is one of the founders of the Anison band JAM Project and has been a regular member ever since its inception in 2000. His nickname is the "Young Lion of Anison" and he goes by the motto "Always Full Voice".

Shouji Kawamori is an anime creator, director and mechanical designer. Also a current advisor for [Satelight](https://anilist.co/studio/41/).

Famous for his work in the [Macross](https://anilist.co/anime/1088/) and Transformers franchises. He pioneered several innovative concepts in his works, such as transforming mecha (including the VF-1 Valkyrie in Macross and Optimus Prime in Transformers) and virtual idols (including Lynn Minmay and Sharon Apple in the Macross franchise).

Kawamori attended Keio University together with Macross screenwriter [Hiroshi Oonogi](https://anilist.co/staff/97701/) and character designer [Haruhiko Mikimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/96968/). There they became friends and founded a [Mobile Suit Gundam](https://anilist.co/anime/80/) fan club called "Gunsight One," a name the group would use years later during the development of the fictional world of the Macross series. Later on his career Kawamori created or co-created the concepts which served as basis for several anime series. His projects are usually noted to contain strong themes of love, war, spirituality or mysticism, and ecological concern.

Kawamori also helped to design various toys for the Takara toyline, Diaclone in the early '80s. Among them the first Optimus Prime toy design, Prowl, Bluestreak, Smokescreen, Ironhide, and Ratchet. Over 20 years later, he returned to Transformers by designing both the Hybrid Style Convoy and the Masterpiece version of Starscream for Takara.
**Ryuu Sakamoto** is a Japanese art designer and background artist.
**Morioka Kenichi** is a Japanese art and set designer, who also does design work.
**Minoru Oonishi** is a Japanese art director and art designer.
Tenpei Mishio is a production manager and episode director.
**Mochizuki Mariko** is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.
